content:
I do not have access to all websites that have successfully implemented keyboard accessibility features. however, i can suggest a few websites that have good keyboard-only accessibility:

1. bbc website: the bbc website has an excellent keyboard-only navigation system that allows users to browse the website without a mouse.

2. gmail: gmail is another website that has great keyboard-only navigation. users can move between emails, compose new emails, and perform other actions using only the keyboard.

3. amazon: amazon's website has a comprehensive keyboard navigation interface that allows users with mobility impairments to easily browse and shop on the site.

4. twitter: twitter also has excellent keyboard-only navigation. users can move between tweets, expand media, and perform other tasks without the use of a mouse.

5. microsoft: microsoft's website is another example of good keyboard-only navigation. users can easily navigate through the site and access all the features without any restrictions.

these websites support various keyboard shortcuts, focus indicators, and semantic html tags, making them easier to navigate with a keyboard.
